'Pinus sabiniana' (sometimes spelled 'P. sabineana'), with the common names
'gray pine', 'California foothill pine', and the more historically and
internationally used 'digger pine', is a pine endemic to California in the
United States. {{Cite web
| title = Data Source and References for Pinus sabiniana (California foothill
| pine) work = USDA PLANTS accessdate = 2012-10-20 url =
| http://plants.usda.gov/java/reference?symbol=PISA2
}} {{Cite book
| title = UC/JEPS: Jepson Manual treatment for PINUS sabiniana accessdate = 2012-10-
| 20 url = http://ucjeps.berkeley.edu/cgi-bin/get_JM_treatment.pl?195,210,232
}} James E. Cole. 1939 Ludwig Beissner. 1909 It is
also known as 'foothill pine', 'ghost pine', 'bull pine', and 'nut pine'. {{Cite web
| title = Calflora: Pinus sabiniana accessdate = 2012-10-20 url = http://www.calflora.org/cgi-bin/species_query.cgi?where-
| calrecnum=6524
}}
